column5: Just home form a great few days on the lake with family and friends. Like most fishing trips, it could have been better or it could have been worse. Like most of the country, it's been hot hot hot up here as well and finding suitable water temps for Brookies was nearly impossible. Between 3 boats we landed about 20 Brook Trout for the weekend. Biggest was a 24" girthy male that probably went 6 lbs. Unfortunately it wasn't caught in my boat and I don't have pics of that one.  Here's a couple of my best fish for the weekend. 20" and 21 1/2". The 21 1/2" fish was spitting up smelts like crazy at boatside during the fight.      Check out the photo section for some scenery shots from the weekend as well.
Awesome Dan I'm jealous haven't been up to fish the Nip now in 4 yrs. Gotta get back.
Don't do this to me Dan....
Those are nice healthy looking fish Dan  Beautiful colors. Nice boat too,looks very comfortable to fish out of.
Awesome fish Dan!  Let's hope those temps drop over the next couple of weeks.
Great to see you got out for some brookies. Nice looking fish. Looks like the one you didn't catch last year....ha...ha. Hope to see you guys up there later this month. Let me know. Alan
Dan good to hear your got out on the water and had a good time
Great to see a report from you Dan.  So glad you had a chance to get away for awhile and enjoy the fishing a family.  Some really nice fish there
beauty fish eh
Nice job Dan   Couple of beauties for sure
Nice, great Brookies!
Beauty fish!  I've never caught brookies before...gotta get out for them some time soon!
Picture perfect fish. Brookies that size are hard or maybe impossible to come by in our area anymore.
Beauties Dan,  Love those big water polka dots I am counting the days to my next Specky adventure....and there are WAY to many days
Nice fish Dan! One day I'll make it up there.
OMG !!!!!   THOSE ARE BEAUTIFUL !!! I've yet to catch my first brookie. Thanks for the inspiration.
Good stuff Dan.
Really nice fish, Dan. What an impressive fishery.
You work so much through your summers Dan, it's great when you get that chance outing and it pays off.  As always, to fish fish like the specks is what we work for.
Thanks for the comments all. With any luck I'll have a few bigger and more colorful specimens to post in another month or so.

Nice stuff Dan.  Perhaps I will mosey on up with Keith on the long weekend in Sept. Hey, you never know, I might even bring my locksmith gear with me so we don't have to climb in through windows!  Cheers, Ron...

lol Ron. If anything, I'm planning a trip the week after labor day weekend. I just started a new job with a new company so I don't know if I can swing the time off so early. With any luck I'll get to taste one of your world famous ceasars sometime late this summer one way or another. Cheers Bud.
Nice brookies Dan. One of these days we are going to have to come up there and pay you  a visit
You're welcome in my boat any time Chris.
